intro: Adenostegia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered adenostegia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and slender, branched stems. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, round fruits. Adenostegia parviflora is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
